page.title: 02PRINCIPAL FEATURES: QUINTON
page.content: This block is centred around the villages of{Upper and Lower Quinton, which lie just North of{Meon Hill,}at the northern limit of the{Cotswolds. Being very near the borders of Gloucs. and Worcs. the area reflects much of the character of the Vale of Evesham. (the Vegetable Garden of England) The land use is predominantly for {farming,}especially cereal crops and pasture.Other{influences,}however, include the Royal Engineer{army base at Long Marston Depot, the tourist centre of Stratford upon Avon, and the semi-redundant{airfield ,Long Marston. Local housing is mixed council, services, private, modern & historic. A small number of indigenous villagers has been added to greatly by these and other influences and so the {population is very mixed,}including a large number of service families.
